seo.title: Seedance 1.5 Pro – Cinematic Text & Image to Video | MaxVideoAI
seo.description: Create cinematic, camera-locked clips with Seedance 1.5 Pro. Text or image to video up to 12s, flexible aspect ratios, and optional audio.

overview: Seedance 1.5 Pro in MaxVideoAI delivers short-form control with camera_fixed, seed repeatability, optional end frames, and native audio. Generate 4–12s clips from text or a single image, with steadier motion and consistent variants when you need them.
pricingNotes: Pricing varies by resolution; audio off costs about 50% less than audio on.

hero.title: Seedance 1.5 Pro – Cinematic Motion Control
hero.intro: Camera-fixed motion, seed control, and audio-ready renders from text or a single frame.

items.title: Product shots with controlled motion (clean, repeatable takes)
Smooth continuity with end frames (I2V resolves / match landings)
Repeatable looks with seed control (variant testing)
Short ads and social clips with audio on/off
Moodboards / key beats before longer edits

technicalOverview.label: Details
technicalOverview.body: Seedance 1.5 Pro is a short-form audio-video model with strong control knobs: camera_fixed for locked-off shots, seed for repeatable iterations, and optional end frame for smoother I2V landings. Use it when you want steadier motion, consistent variants, and audio-ready drafts in 4–12 second clips.

technicalOverview.label: Inputs
technicalOverview.body: Text → Video; Image → Video with optional end frame (PNG/JPG/WebP)

technicalOverview.label: Controls
technicalOverview.body: Seed (-1 for random), camera fixed, safety checker

technicalOverview.label: Audio
technicalOverview.body: On by default; toggle off for lower cost

promptStructure.title: Prompting Seedance 1.5 Pro
promptStructure.quote: [Subject] [one clear action] in [setting], camera_fixed, [lighting/style], [duration], optional audio.
promptStructure.description: Keep prompts shot-level, favor camera_fixed for steadier motion, and add concise audio notes if enabled.

tips.title: Tips & limits
items: Use camera_fixed for locked-off shots and steadier motion.
Add an end frame for smoother I2V resolves.
Reuse a seed for repeatable variations.
Keep clips short (4–12s) for best coherence.

prompts.title: Locked camera neon alley
prompts.prompt: A moody 16:9 neon alley in light rain, camera locked, reflective puddles, subtle ambience, soft audio bed.

prompts.title: Image to video with end frame
prompts.prompt: Animate the start image with a slow push-in, then resolve into the provided end frame, gentle ambience.

faqs.a: It locks the camera for steadier motion and stronger continuity between frames.
Yes. Audio is on by default but you can toggle it off for lower cost.
T2V supports 480p and 720p. I2V supports 480p, 720p, and 1080p.

heroHighlights: Camera-fixed stability||Lock the camera for steadier motion and cleaner results in city/product scenes
Seed control for repeatability||Reuse a seed to iterate without the look drifting — great for campaign variants and A/B hooks
Start + end frame control (I2V)||Provide an optional end frame to guide how the shot lands (transitions, match cuts, clean finishes)
Native audio in the same render||Generate dialogue, ambience, and SFX in one pass — or toggle audio off for silent drafts and post finishing
custom.promptingTitle: How to Write a Great Seedance 1.5 Pro Prompt
custom.promptingIntro: Seedance 1.5 Pro performs best with clear subject/action, controlled camera direction (often camera-fixed), and concise audio notes when audio is enabled.
promptingGlobalPrinciples: Prefer camera-fixed shots when you want steadier motion and fewer artifacts.
Keep one readable action per clip (or per beat).
Use a seed when iterating — change one variable at a time.
If audio is on: keep dialogue short and add only 1–2 sound cues.
promptingEngineWhy: camera_fixed is a strength: use it for locked camera realism and product shots.
Seedance is short-form: keep beats simple and avoid cramming multiple actions.
End frame (I2V) helps land transitions; don’t introduce new actions in the last second.
Audio is best with minimal cues; long monologues can drift.
If text matters, plan to overlay it in post (tiny text is unreliable).

promptingTabs.label: Quick
promptingTabs.title: Quick prompt (fast iteration)
promptingTabs.description: Use 1–2 sentences when you want variations.
promptingTabs.copy:
[Subject] [one clear action] in [setting], [framing], [lighting/style].
Audio (optional): [ambience + 1 key SFX OR one short line].
Negative: no text, no logos, no subtitles/overlays.

promptingTabs.label: Structured
promptingTabs.title: Structured prompt (best for reliable results)
promptingTabs.description: Separate information so the model can follow it consistently.
promptingTabs.copy:
Subject:
[Who/what + 2–3 defining details.]

Setting:
[Where + time + 2 anchors.]

Camera:
[Framing + (camera_fixed recommended) OR one simple move.]

Look:
[Lighting + palette anchors.]

Audio (optional):
Dialogue: “Short line.”
Ambience + 1–2 SFX cues.

Negative:
[Text, logos, extra people, blur.]

promptingTabs.label: Pro
promptingTabs.title: Pro prompt (ultra-specific "film crew brief")
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you need a very specific cinematic look or continuity across shots.
promptingTabs.copy:
Director brief:
[Goal + vibe.]

Continuity anchors:
- Subject identity + wardrobe/props
- Location + time + 3 visual anchors
- Lighting + palette anchors

Camera:
- Framing + angle
- Prefer camera_fixed for steadiness (or one simple move)

Audio (if on):
- Dialogue: “One short line.”
- Ambience + 1–2 SFX cues (keep it minimal)

Seed (recommended for iterations):
Reuse the same seed when generating variants.

promptingTabs.label: Storyboard
promptingTabs.title: Storyboard prompt (sequenced beats)
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you want a mini-story in one clip. A storyboard prompt (aka sequenced beats) gives clear timing, camera direction, and continuity.
promptingTabs.copy:
Duration: [4–12s] • Aspect: [21:9 / 16:9 / 4:3 / 1:1 / 3:4 / 9:16] • Audio: [on/off]

Beat 1 (0–4s):
[Framing + action + camera direction]

Beat 2 (4–8s):
[Framing + action + camera direction]

Beat 3 (8–12s):
[Final action/reveal + settle]
End frame (optional, I2V): [describe the final frame you want to land on]

Audio (if on):
Dialogue: “Short line.”
Ambience + 1–2 SFX cues.

Constraints:
No logos. No readable text. No subtitles/overlays.

strengths: Use camera_fixed for locked-off shots and steadier motion.
Reuse a seed for repeatable variations.
Add an end frame for smoother I2V resolves and cleaner landings.
Keep clips short (4–12s) and actions simple for best coherence.
Use audio sparingly: one short line + ambience + 1 key SFX.
troubleshootingItems: Motion feels messy → enable camera_fixed; reduce action speed; simplify background.
Drift across takes → lock a seed; keep the same prompt structure; change one variable.
Audio/lip sync drifts → shorten lines; avoid fast head turns; keep the shot calmer.
Random text/logos → strengthen negative ("no text, no logos, no UI") and keep signage out of frame.
boundaries: Resolution and pricing vary by tier; check the live spec chips before rendering.
Still no reliable tiny on-screen text — overlay critical copy in post.
